conclusion: Determine the output power by finding the intersection point of the two lines.
Line I is the relationship graph between terminal voltage and current of the power source. Line II is the volt-ampere characteristic curve of the resistor R.
Line I equation: V = V_0 - IR, where V_0 is open-circuit voltage and R is internal resistance.
Line II equation: V = IR, representing the resistor's volt-ampere characteristic.
Set the equations equal to find the intersection: V_0 - IR = IR.
Solve for I: V_0 = 2IR, thus I = V_0 / 2R.
Calculate voltage at intersection: V = IR = (V_0 / 2R)R = V_0 / 2.
Calculate output power: P = V x I = (V_0 / 2) x (V_0 / 2R) = V_0^2 / 4R.
Final answer: Output power is P = V_0^2 / 4R.
